reviewText: I love this movie. I've been watching it over and over again through the years. It cracks me up
It will not play any of my DVD players
This is one of my all-time favorite films. I am really happy to finally own it.

I get bored easily so it took me a few times watching it to really enjoy it. I had heard raving reviews so my expectations were high. It did not meet those expectations. It was good and I did laugh out loud a few times.
Somethings you just need immediate access to. Mickey Rourke in his prime is one of them.
This is such a classic from back in the day.  Mickey Rourke and Eric Roberts give great performances, with some very funny, and poignant moments. They don't make 'em like this anymore:)
Luv the movie. Just wish it was in Blu-Ray

Briefly: This is an excellent film. Funny, very ethnic Italian mafioso depictions, life on the street in Greenwich Village in the early 1980s, lots of early 80's clothing, essentially a drama/comedy/thriller with emphasis on character development of the two main characters. Acting is very good, with a bit of over-the-top acting by Eric Roberts, who plays kind of a dumb/uneducated guy who is always on the lookout for a scheme to get money (even if it's not legal). Mickey Rourke plays a smarter guy who is attempting to plan for his future. But, he is connected at the hip to his idiot cousin (Eric Roberts). They steal money from the mafia using Robert's plan, but Roberts never told his cousin that it was mafia money they were stealing. Bad things ensue, as you can imagine. Good plot, very entertaining.
Loved it since I first saw it 30 years ago. Had to have it in my collection.
